definition: to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: Click on the picture to see full size version.
sentences.chinese: 各位看官，一定記著“按”圖放大，纔看到多點細節。

sentences.english: Dear reader, this is the way it's supposed to work.
sentences.chinese: 各位親愛的看官，這個辦法看似可行呀。

sentences.english: Tell me what you do not know whether to feel good like it?
sentences.chinese: 不曉得各位看官是否覺得這樣的不錯呢？

sentences.english: Do not think we can get the same value compensation with the house.
sentences.chinese: 看官別以爲我們能夠得到相應的賠償。
列位看官，它，守衛着一些別的祕密。

sentences.english: Tell me what your soul's made of, and I'll tell you about mine.
sentences.chinese: 看官，你的靈魂的了，我要告訴你們的礦井。

definition: to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
(polite appellation for a guest at a hotel etc)
editor or creator of online content (diminutive term, often used to refer to oneself: I, me, this writer)
darlings/fans/followers/short form of 親愛的們|亲爱的们
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
to return to the topic (idiom)/to get back to the main point
to just talk for the sake of talking
